snippet: An analysis by Comptroller Scott M. Stringer found that after paying more than $2 billion in fees to money managers, New York City’s pension funds have received virtually nothing in return.
abstract: Analysis by New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer finds that city's five pension funds have received virtually nothing in return after paying some $2.5 billion in fees to money managers; remains unclear what changes will be instituted in wake of findings.
lead_paragraph: An analysis by Comptroller Scott M. Stringer found that after paying more than $2 billion in fees to money managers, New York City’s pension funds have received virtually nothing in return.

headline.main: Wall Street Fees Wipe Out $2.5 Billion in New York City Pension Gains
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Fees Wipe Out $2.5 Billion in City Pension Gains
